THIS ONE IS CLOSED. GO HERE FOR THE NEWER CHALLENGE!

Download 0.7.3 here

Ã¢â‚¬Å“It started out very lowkey,Ã¢â‚¬Â Falanghe told the Report. Ã¢â‚¬Å“The first idea I pitched was actually 2DÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ it could have been done in Flash. Basically you built a space craft, and tried to launch it as high as it would goÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ and that was basically it. It was kind of like a high score game.Ã¢â‚¬Â

His employers liked the idea and greenlit the project. Feature after feature would be added until eventually the game was released to the public in 2011 with version 0.7.3, a very simplistic version of the Kerbal Space Program available today.

Let's go as high as you can go! 1 meter off the ground=1 point!

Bonus for orbit: 100000 points.

Screenshots (*required) (use Windowskey Printscreen/printscreen and paste to imgur) are VAB, Inflight, and *stats screen

My attempt:

I get 31023 points.

FOR MAC USERS use 0.10, and no struts, fuel pipes, or stacking liquid fuel tanks, then all you get is a minus 100 points for being a mac user unauthenticity.

Whenever I play an early version of the game, it's like a mix of early Career mode and model rockets.

Edited November 2, 2013 by Ojimak
If I use 0.10, does that still count? first version for mac. No map view included.

Here's what I got together after a few tries: 277498m

Javascript is disabled. View full album

If I use 0.10, does that still count? first version for mac. No map view included.

no struts, fuel pipes, etc, then all you get is a minus 100 points.

Here's what I got together after a few tries: 277498m

-snip-

That wasn't orbit, was it? If not, then there's no reason to turn over.

EDIT: oh, the craft was not very controlable, was it

That wasn't orbit, was it? If not, then there's no reason to turn over.

EDIT: oh, the craft was not very controlable, was it

Your edited notion is correct, on launch it started to ever so slowly tilt (no symmetry function so it wasn't 100% balanced) and the only thing I could do was to try and hold it steady. Staging was also a bit rough.
Engine thrust also seems to make things explode more easily.

I attempted it with 0.10 and even reached escape velocity. But then I realized, that you can't stack fuel tanks in 0.7.3, so it's no legit entry.

Maybe I'll try without fuel tank stacking later.

I think I reached escape trajectory. Not sure, but the speed drops very slowly and the altitude keeps building up. Apparently SRBs were a bit overpowered and with use of enough SAS modules it was possible to keep them somehow under control. All it needed then were two stages of tank+engine.

It's shaking a lot at altitude (472 km at the moment), Kraken was clearly not under control yet.

Edit: I added another image to the album after I reached 1000 km. Speed is still over 1600 m/s and decreasing by tenths.

Edit 2: at about 1300 km I noticed that Kerbin started to clip out of the view. Details were not becoming smaller but the circle was decreasing rapidly. And at 1480 km it disappeared completely.

Edit 3: the trajectory seems to be elliptical after all - at 2000 km I noticed the pitch decreased from about 40Ã‚Â° to about 35Ã‚Â°. But I don't have enough time to watch how far will it go. I believe it could still be considered orbit taking into account the initial pitch and speed after last burn.
